skill.name: Swarm Orchestration
skill.description: Orchestrate multi-agent swarms with agentic-flow for parallel task execution, dynamic topology, and intelligent coordination. Use when scaling beyond single agents, implementing complex workflows, or building distributed AI systems.
skill.summary: Orchestrate multi-agent swarms with agentic-flow for parallel task execution, dynamic topology, and ...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with example code snippets. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. The skill provides instructional guidance for using agentic-flow commands.

content.value_statement: Building complex AI systems with multiple agents requires sophisticated coordination. This skill provides proven patterns and commands for orchestrating agent swarms with automatic load balancing, fault tolerance, and intelligent task distribution.
actual_capabilities: Initialize multi-agent swarms with mesh, hierarchical, or adaptive topologies
Execute tasks in parallel or pipeline mode with automatic load balancing
Share memory and state across all agents in the swarm
Handle agent failures with retry policies and automatic reassignment
Monitor swarm metrics including throughput, latency, and success rates
limitations: Requires agentic-flow v1.5.11+ to be installed
Does not create or manage actual agent processes itself
Limited to coordination patterns defined in agentic-flow

use_cases.title: Build distributed AI systems
use_cases.description: Coordinate multiple specialized AI agents to build complex software systems in parallel

use_cases.title: Automate CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Orchestrate testing, building, and deployment tasks across multiple agent types

use_cases.title: Scale AI experiments
use_cases.description: Run multiple research tasks concurrently with automatic load balancing and fault tolerance

prompt_templates.title: Parallel development
prompt_templates.prompt: Use swarm orchestration to build a REST API with tests. Initialize a mesh topology with 3 agents: coder, tester, and reviewer. Execute tasks in parallel mode.

prompt_templates.title: Sequential pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pipeline for feature development using hierarchical topology. Use architect for design, coder for implementation, tester for testing, and reviewer for code review.

prompt_templates.title: Resilient execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Orchestrate a build task with fault tolerance enabled. Set retry with exponential backoff and automatic fallback to reassign tasks on failure. Monitor metrics throughout.

prompt_templates.title: Adaptive scaling
prompt_templates.prompt: Run an adaptive swarm for building a production-ready API. Allow the swarm to automatically select topology and scale agents based on task complexity. Set max time to 1 hour.

output_examples.input: Build a web application with tests using swarm orchestration
output: Swarm initialized with mesh topology (3 agents)
All tasks completed in parallel - 12 minutes total

best_practices: Start with 2-3 agents and scale up as you understand the task requirements
Use swarm memory coordination to share context instead of repeating information
Always set timeouts to prevent hung tasks from blocking the entire swarm
anti_patterns: Do not run too many agents simultaneously without load balancing enabled
Avoid long-running tasks without monitoring metrics and progress
Do not skip setting up hooks for pre-task and post-task coordination

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. You need agentic-flow v1.5.11 or higher installed.

faq.question: What are the limits on swarm size?
faq.answer: The default maximum is 5 agents for mesh topology. You can configure this with the --max-agents flag for larger swarms.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Use the hooks integration (pre-task, post-task, session-restore) to coordinate with your existing development workflow and tools.

faq.question: Is my data safe with swarm orchestration?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides coordination patterns. All data remains in your environment and is not sent to external services.

faq.question: Why are my agents not coordinating?
faq.answer: Verify that you have enabled hooks and that all agents have access to the shared memory store. Check your topology configuration.

faq.question: How is this different from regular agent usage?
faq.answer: Regular agents work alone. Swarm orchestration coordinates multiple specialized agents working together with shared state, load balancing, and fault tolerance.
